subject: Football
lead_paragraph: Minnesota tackle Bryant McKinnie was arrested for aggravated battery after a brawl outside a nightclub in Miami early Sunday. McKinnie was also charged with disorderly conduct and resisting arrest without violence, according to a police report.The police report said that the authorities were called to Club Space after a fight broke out; McKinnie had been thrown out by a nightclub security guard and was arguing and spit on Eric Otero. Otero, 32, said he would not press charges if McKinnie left. The police said McKinnie then went to a nearby strip club, but returned and fought again with Otero.The 6-foot-8, 335-pound McKinnie, a starter on the Vikings’ offensive line who was drafted out of Miami in 2002, was arrested and bonded out for $9,000, the Miami-Dade County Corrections Department spokeswoman Janelle Hall said.
